verses.text: 古實河外，船隻彼此碰撞，響聲四起之地，有禍了！

words.note: Implies sound or movement from all directions.
Literary phrase, 'place of...'

verses.text: 這就是那經常差派使者，在水面上乘坐蒲草船渡海的地方。去吧！快行的使者，到那身軀高大、皮膚光滑的國去，到一個遠近都為人所懼怕的民族那裡去，這國是強盛和踐踏人的，他們的地有河流把地分開。

words.note: 蒲草 (púcǎo) specifically refers to papyrus or cattail.
A common literary passive structure.
Indicates direct object is affected by verb.

verses.text: 世上所有的居民，住在全地上的人哪！山上豎起旗幟的時候，你們要注意；號角吹響的時候，你們要聆聽。

words.note: Indicates a rhetorical question or exclamation.

verses.text: 耶和華這樣對我說：「我要從我的居所安靜觀看，像日光中閃爍的熱氣，又像收割時的熱氣中有露水的雲彩。」
因為在收割以前，花蕾開盡，花朵也成了將熟的葡萄之時，他就用鐮刀削去嫩枝，又砍掉蔓延的枝子。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive/descriptive particle.

verses.text: 它們都要撇下，給山間的鷙鳥，和地上的野獸；鷙鳥必吃它們來度過夏天，地上的百獸必吃它們來度過冬天。

words.note: Indicates future tense or desire.
Literally 'to cast down', implies abandonment.
Refers to birds like eagles, vultures.

words.definition: on the earth, on the ground

words.note: Indicates strong certainty of future action.
Connects an action with its purpose.
Refers to a multitude or all kinds of beasts.

verses.text: 到那時，這個身軀高大、皮膚光滑的國，就是遠近都為人所懼怕的民族，強盛和踐踏人的國，他們的地有河流把地分開，他們必把禮物帶來給萬軍之耶和華，就是奉到錫安山，萬軍之耶和華立他名的地方。

words.note: Indicates a point in time or a goal.
Implies 'by all people, from all directions'.
Used in passive constructions, '為...所...'.
Forms passive voice with '為'.
Marks the object of a verb to indicate its disposal or impact.
The Hebrew name for God, 'Jehovah of Armies'.
Implies a respectful or ceremonial offering.
A mountain in Jerusalem, symbolic of God's presence.
